column135: Generally, the lower down in the stack, the greater benefit to being open-source. Conversely, the most high level applications such as AI benefit little from FOSS because there are so many nuances and specifics involved.
column168: Open source as “digital commons” public good
column178: We don't want to heavily incentivize, because we don't want to polute and dilute the FOSS landscape with haphazard poorly constructed stuff only to "check a box" of contribution and make money. FOSS contribution should, thus, be out of goodness of heart alone.
